spec.description: Customizing Envoy configuration generated by Istio. See more details at: https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/networking/envoy-filter.html

configPatches.description: One or more patches with match conditions.

name.description: The exact name of the cluster to match.

portNumber.description: The service port for which this cluster was generated.

service.description: The fully qualified service name for this cluster.

subset.description: The subset associated with the service.

context.description: The specific config generation context to match on.

filterChain.description: Match a specific filter chain in a listener.

destinationPort.description: The destination_port value used by a filter chain's match condition.

filter.description: The name of a specific filter to apply the patch to.

name.description: The filter name to match on.
The filter name to match on.
The name assigned to the filter chain.

sni.description: The SNI value used by a filter chain's match condition.

name.description: Match a specific listener by its name.

proxy.description: Match on properties associated with a proxy.

routeConfiguration.description: Match on envoy HTTP route configuration attributes.

name.description: Route configuration name to match on.

route.description: Match a specific route within the virtual host.

action.description: Match a route with specific action type.

patch.description: The patch to apply along with the operation.

operation.description: Determines how the patch should be applied.

value.description: The JSON config of the object being patched.

priority.description: Priority defines the order in which patch sets are applied within a context.

spec.description: RequestAuthentication defines what request authentication methods are supported by a workload.

jwtRules.description: Define the list of JWTs that can be validated at the selected workloads' proxy.

forwardOriginalToken.description: If set to true, the original token will be kept for the upstream request.

fromHeaders.description: List of header locations from which JWT is expected.

prefix.description: The prefix that should be stripped before decoding the token.

fromParams.description: List of query parameters from which JWT is expected.

issuer.description: Identifies the issuer that issued the JWT.

jwks.description: JSON Web Key Set of public keys to validate signature of the JWT.

outputClaimToHeaders.description: This field specifies a list of operations to copy the claim to HTTP headers on a successfully verified token.

claim.description: The name of the claim to be copied from.

header.description: The name of the header to be created.

spec.description: RequestAuthentication defines what request authentication methods are supported by a workload.

jwtRules.description: Define the list of JWTs that can be validated at the selected workloads' proxy.

forwardOriginalToken.description: If set to true, the original token will be kept for the upstream request.

fromHeaders.description: List of header locations from which JWT is expected.

prefix.description: The prefix that should be stripped before decoding the token.

fromParams.description: List of query parameters from which JWT is expected.

issuer.description: Identifies the issuer that issued the JWT.

jwks.description: JSON Web Key Set of public keys to validate signature of the JWT.

outputClaimToHeaders.description: This field specifies a list of operations to copy the claim to HTTP headers on a successfully verified token.

claim.description: The name of the claim to be copied from.

header.description: The name of the header to be created.

additionalProperties.description: List of users who will also be added to the Postgres cluster

additionalMembers.description: Map for teamId and associated additional users

additionalProperties.description: List of teams to become Postgres superusers

additionalSuperuserTeams.description: Map for teamId and associated additional superuser teams

additionalProperties.description: List of teams whose members will also be added to the Postgres cluster

additionalTeams.description: Map for teamId and associated additional teams

openAPIV3Schema.description: L2Advertisement allows to advertise the LoadBalancer IPs provided by the selected pools via L2.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: L2AdvertisementSpec defines the desired state of L2Advertisement.

ipAddressPoolSelectors.description: A selector for the IPAddressPools which would get advertised via this advertisement. If no IPAddressPool is selected by this or by the list, the advertisement is applied to all the IPAddressPools.

items.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null label selector matches no objects.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

items.description: A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

ipAddressPools.description: The list of IPAddressPools to advertise via this advertisement, selected by name.

nodeSelectors.description: NodeSelectors allows to limit the nodes to announce as next hops for the LoadBalancer IP. When empty, all the nodes having  are announced as next hops.

items.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null label selector matches no objects.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

items.description: A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

status.description: L2AdvertisementStatus defines the observed state of L2Advertisement.

openAPIV3Schema.description: AddressPool is the Schema for the addresspools API.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: AddressPoolSpec defines the desired state of AddressPool.

addresses.description: A list of IP address ranges over which MetalLB has authority. You can list multiple ranges in a single pool, they will all share the same settings. Each range can be either a CIDR prefix, or an explicit start-end range of IPs.

autoAssign.description: AutoAssign flag used to prevent MetallB from automatic allocation for a pool.

bgpAdvertisements.description: When an IP is allocated from this pool, how should it be translated into BGP announcements?

aggregationLength.description: The aggregation-length advertisement option lets you roll up the /32s into a larger prefix.

aggregationLengthV6.description: Optional, defaults to 128 (i.e. no aggregation) if not specified.

localPref.description: BGP LOCAL_PREF attribute which is used by BGP best path algorithm, Path with higher localpref is preferred over one with lower localpref.

protocol.description: Protocol can be used to select how the announcement is done.

status.description: AddressPoolStatus defines the observed state of AddressPool.

versions.deprecationWarning: metallb.io v1beta1 AddressPool is deprecated, consider using IPAddressPool
versions.name: v1beta1

openAPIV3Schema.description: AddressPool represents a pool of IP addresses that can be allocated to LoadBalancer services. AddressPool is deprecated and being replaced by IPAddressPool.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: AddressPoolSpec defines the desired state of AddressPool.

addresses.description: A list of IP address ranges over which MetalLB has authority. You can list multiple ranges in a single pool, they will all share the same settings. Each range can be either a CIDR prefix, or an explicit start-end range of IPs.

autoAssign.description: AutoAssign flag used to prevent MetallB from automatic allocation for a pool.

bgpAdvertisements.description: Drives how an IP allocated from this pool should translated into BGP announcements.

aggregationLength.description: The aggregation-length advertisement option lets you roll up the /32s into a larger prefix.

aggregationLengthV6.description: Optional, defaults to 128 (i.e. no aggregation) if not specified.

communities.description: BGP communities to be associated with the given advertisement.

localPref.description: BGP LOCAL_PREF attribute which is used by BGP best path algorithm, Path with higher localpref is preferred over one with lower localpref.

protocol.description: Protocol can be used to select how the announcement is done.

status.description: AddressPoolStatus defines the observed state of AddressPool.

openAPIV3Schema.description: BGPPeer is the Schema for the peers API.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: BGPPeerSpec defines the desired state of Peer.

holdTime.description: Requested BGP hold time, per RFC4271.

keepaliveTime.description: Requested BGP keepalive time, per RFC4271.

myASN.description: AS number to use for the local end of the session.

nodeSelectors.description: Only connect to this peer on nodes that match one of these selectors.

password.description: Authentication password for routers enforcing TCP MD5 authenticated sessions

peerASN.description: AS number to expect from the remote end of the session.

peerAddress.description: Address to dial when establishing the session.

peerPort.description: Port to dial when establishing the session.

routerID.description: BGP router ID to advertise to the peer

sourceAddress.description: Source address to use when establishing the session.

status.description: BGPPeerStatus defines the observed state of Peer.

openAPIV3Schema.description: BGPPeer is the Schema for the peers API.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: BGPPeerSpec defines the desired state of Peer.

bfdProfile.description: The name of the BFD Profile to be used for the BFD session associated to the BGP session. If not set, the BFD session won't be set up.

ebgpMultiHop.description: To set if the BGPPeer is multi-hops away. Needed for FRR mode only.

holdTime.description: Requested BGP hold time, per RFC4271.

keepaliveTime.description: Requested BGP keepalive time, per RFC4271.

myASN.description: AS number to use for the local end of the session.

nodeSelectors.description: Only connect to this peer on nodes that match one of these selectors.

items.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null label selector matches no objects.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

items.description: A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

password.description: Authentication password for routers enforcing TCP MD5 authenticated sessions

passwordSecret.description: passwordSecret is name of the authentication secret for BGP Peer. the secret must be of type "kubernetes.io/basic-auth", and created in the same namespace as the MetalLB deployment. The password is stored in the secret as the key "password".

name.description: Name is unique within a namespace to reference a secret resource.

namespace.description: Namespace defines the space within which the secret name must be unique.

peerASN.description: AS number to expect from the remote end of the session.

peerAddress.description: Address to dial when establishing the session.

peerPort.description: Port to dial when establishing the session.

routerID.description: BGP router ID to advertise to the peer

sourceAddress.description: Source address to use when establishing the session.

status.description: BGPPeerStatus defines the observed state of Peer.

spec.description: Configuration affecting edge load balancer. See more details at: https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/networking/gateway.html

hosts.description: One or more hosts exposed by this gateway.

name.description: An optional name of the server, when set must be unique across all servers.

number.description: A valid non-negative integer port number.

protocol.description: The protocol exposed on the port.

tls.description: Set of TLS related options that govern the server's behavior.

cipherSuites.description: Optional: If specified, only support the specified cipher list.

spec.description: Configuration affecting edge load balancer. See more details at: https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/networking/gateway.html

hosts.description: One or more hosts exposed by this gateway.

cipherSuites.description: Optional: If specified, only support the specified cipher list.

additionalPrinterColumns.name: Image

additionalPrinterColumns.description: Label for K8s resources created by operator
additionalPrinterColumns.name: Cluster-Label

additionalPrinterColumns.description: Name of service account to be used
additionalPrinterColumns.name: Service-Account

additionalPrinterColumns.description: Minimum number of instances per Postgres cluster

openAPIV3Schema.description: BFDProfile represents the settings of the bfd session that can be optionally associated with a BGP session.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: BFDProfileSpec defines the desired state of BFDProfile.

detectMultiplier.description: Configures the detection multiplier to determine packet loss. The remote transmission interval will be multiplied by this value to determine the connection loss detection timer.

echoInterval.description: Configures the minimal echo receive transmission interval that this system is capable of handling in milliseconds. Defaults to 50ms

echoMode.description: Enables or disables the echo transmission mode. This mode is disabled by default, and not supported on multi hops setups.

minimumTtl.description: For multi hop sessions only: configure the minimum expected TTL for an incoming BFD control packet.

passiveMode.description: Mark session as passive: a passive session will not attempt to start the connection and will wait for control packets from peer before it begins replying.

receiveInterval.description: The minimum interval that this system is capable of receiving control packets in milliseconds. Defaults to 300ms.

transmitInterval.description: The minimum transmission interval (less jitter) that this system wants to use to send BFD control packets in milliseconds. Defaults to 300ms

status.description: BFDProfileStatus defines the observed state of BFDProfile.

spec.description: Provides configuration for individual workloads. See more details at: https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/networking/proxy-config.html

concurrency.description: The number of worker threads to run.

environmentVariables.description: Additional environment variables for the proxy.

image.description: Specifies the details of the proxy image.

imageType.description: The image type of the image.

additionalPrinterColumns.description: Istio control plane revision
additionalPrinterColumns.name: Revision

additionalPrinterColumns.description: IOP current state
additionalPrinterColumns.name: Status

additionalPrinterColumns.description: CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC. Populated by the system. Read-only. Null for lists. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#metadata
additionalPrinterColumns.name: Age

additionalPrinterColumns.description: The name of a service from the service registry
additionalPrinterColumns.name: Host

additionalPrinterColumns.description: CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC. Populated by the system. Read-only. Null for lists. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#metadata
additionalPrinterColumns.name: Age

spec.description: Configuration affecting load balancing, outlier detection, etc. See more details at: https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/networking/destination-rule.html

exportTo.description: A list of namespaces to which this destination rule is exported.

host.description: The name of a service from the service registry.

trafficPolicy.description: Traffic policies that apply to this subset.

h2UpgradePolicy.description: Specify if http1.1 connection should be upgraded to http2 for the associated destination.

http2MaxRequests.description: Maximum number of active requests to a destination.

idleTimeout.description: The idle timeout for upstream connection pool connections.

maxRequestsPerConnection.description: Maximum number of requests per connection to a backend.

useClientProtocol.description: If set to true, client protocol will be preserved while initiating connection to backend.

tcp.description: Settings common to both HTTP and TCP upstream connections.

maxConnectionDuration.description: The maximum duration of a connection.

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of HTTP1 /TCP connections to a destination host.

tcpKeepalive.description: If set then set SO_KEEPALIVE on the socket to enable TCP Keepalives.

interval.description: The time duration between keep-alive probes.

loadBalancer.description: Settings controlling the load balancer algorithms.

path.description: Path to set for the cookie.

httpHeaderName.description: Hash based on a specific HTTP header.

httpQueryParameterName.description: Hash based on a specific HTTP query parameter.

maglev.description: The Maglev load balancer implements consistent hashing to backend hosts.

tableSize.description: The table size for Maglev hashing.

ringHash.description: The ring/modulo hash load balancer implements consistent hashing to backend hosts.

useSourceIp.description: Hash based on the source IP address.

distribute.description: Optional: only one of distribute, failover or failoverPriority can be set.

to.description: Map of upstream localities to traffic distribution weights.

enabled.description: enable locality load balancing, this is DestinationRule-level and will override mesh wide settings in entirety.

failover.description: Optional: only one of distribute, failover or failoverPriority can be set.

failoverPriority.description: failoverPriority is an ordered list of labels used to sort endpoints to do priority based load balancing.

warmupDurationSecs.description: Represents the warmup duration of Service.

consecutive5xxErrors.description: Number of 5xx errors before a host is ejected from the connection pool.

consecutiveGatewayErrors.description: Number of gateway errors before a host is ejected from the connection pool.

interval.description: Time interval between ejection sweep analysis.

splitExternalLocalOriginErrors.description: Determines whether to distinguish local origin failures from external errors.

portLevelSettings.description: Traffic policies specific to individual ports.

spec.description: Configuration affecting load balancing, outlier detection, etc. See more details at: https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/networking/destination-rule.html

exportTo.description: A list of namespaces to which this destination rule is exported.

host.description: The name of a service from the service registry.

trafficPolicy.description: Traffic policies that apply to this subset.

h2UpgradePolicy.description: Specify if http1.1 connection should be upgraded to http2 for the associated destination.

http2MaxRequests.description: Maximum number of active requests to a destination.

idleTimeout.description: The idle timeout for upstream connection pool connections.

maxRequestsPerConnection.description: Maximum number of requests per connection to a backend.

useClientProtocol.description: If set to true, client protocol will be preserved while initiating connection to backend.

tcp.description: Settings common to both HTTP and TCP upstream connections.

maxConnectionDuration.description: The maximum duration of a connection.

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of HTTP1 /TCP connections to a destination host.

tcpKeepalive.description: If set then set SO_KEEPALIVE on the socket to enable TCP Keepalives.

interval.description: The time duration between keep-alive probes.

loadBalancer.description: Settings controlling the load balancer algorithms.

path.description: Path to set for the cookie.

httpHeaderName.description: Hash based on a specific HTTP header.

httpQueryParameterName.description: Hash based on a specific HTTP query parameter.

maglev.description: The Maglev load balancer implements consistent hashing to backend hosts.

tableSize.description: The table size for Maglev hashing.

ringHash.description: The ring/modulo hash load balancer implements consistent hashing to backend hosts.

useSourceIp.description: Hash based on the source IP address.

distribute.description: Optional: only one of distribute, failover or failoverPriority can be set.

to.description: Map of upstream localities to traffic distribution weights.

enabled.description: enable locality load balancing, this is DestinationRule-level and will override mesh wide settings in entirety.

failover.description: Optional: only one of distribute, failover or failoverPriority can be set.

failoverPriority.description: failoverPriority is an ordered list of labels used to sort endpoints to do priority based load balancing.

warmupDurationSecs.description: Represents the warmup duration of Service.

consecutive5xxErrors.description: Number of 5xx errors before a host is ejected from the connection pool.

splitExternalLocalOriginErrors.description: Determines whether to distinguish local origin failures from external errors.

spec.description: Extend the functionality provided by the Istio proxy through WebAssembly filters. See more details at: https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/proxy_extensions/wasm-plugin.html

imagePullSecret.description: Credentials to use for OCI image pulling.

match.description: Specifies the criteria to determine which traffic is passed to WasmPlugin.

mode.description: Criteria for selecting traffic by their direction.

ports.description: Criteria for selecting traffic by their destination port.

phase.description: Determines where in the filter chain this `WasmPlugin` is to be injected.

pluginConfig.description: The configuration that will be passed on to the plugin.

priority.description: Determines ordering of `WasmPlugins` in the same `phase`.

sha256.description: SHA256 checksum that will be used to verify Wasm module or OCI container.

url.description: URL of a Wasm module or OCI container.

env.description: Specifies environment variables to be injected to this VM.

openAPIV3Schema.description: IPAddressPool represents a pool of IP addresses that can be allocated to LoadBalancer services.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: IPAddressPoolSpec defines the desired state of IPAddressPool.

addresses.description: A list of IP address ranges over which MetalLB has authority. You can list multiple ranges in a single pool, they will all share the same settings. Each range can be either a CIDR prefix, or an explicit start-end range of IPs.

autoAssign.description: AutoAssign flag used to prevent MetallB from automatic allocation for a pool.

avoidBuggyIPs.description: AvoidBuggyIPs prevents addresses ending with .0 and .255 to be used by a pool.

status.description: IPAddressPoolStatus defines the observed state of IPAddressPool.

data.mesh:
defaultConfig:
  discoveryAddress: istiod.battery-istio.svc:15012
  tracing:
    zipkin:
      address: zipkin.battery-istio:9411
enablePrometheusMerge: true
rootNamespace: null
trustDomain: cluster.local

openAPIV3Schema.description: BGPAdvertisement allows to advertise the IPs coming from the selected IPAddressPools via BGP, setting the parameters of the BGP Advertisement.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: BGPAdvertisementSpec defines the desired state of BGPAdvertisement.

aggregationLength.description: The aggregation-length advertisement option lets you roll up the /32s into a larger prefix. Defaults to 32. Works for IPv4 addresses.

aggregationLengthV6.description: The aggregation-length advertisement option lets you roll up the /128s into a larger prefix. Defaults to 128. Works for IPv6 addresses.

communities.description: The BGP communities to be associated with the announcement. Each item can be a community of the form 1234:1234 or the name of an alias defined in the Community CRD.

ipAddressPoolSelectors.description: A selector for the IPAddressPools which would get advertised via this advertisement. If no IPAddressPool is selected by this or by the list, the advertisement is applied to all the IPAddressPools.

items.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null label selector matches no objects.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

items.description: A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

ipAddressPools.description: The list of IPAddressPools to advertise via this advertisement, selected by name.

localPref.description: The BGP LOCAL_PREF attribute which is used by BGP best path algorithm, Path with higher localpref is preferred over one with lower localpref.

nodeSelectors.description: NodeSelectors allows to limit the nodes to announce as next hops for the LoadBalancer IP. When empty, all the nodes having  are announced as next hops.

items.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null label selector matches no objects.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

items.description: A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

peers.description: Peers limits the bgppeer to advertise the ips of the selected pools to. When empty, the loadbalancer IP is announced to all the BGPPeers configured.

status.description: BGPAdvertisementStatus defines the observed state of BGPAdvertisement.

expression.description: CEL expression for selecting when requests/connections should be logged.

match.description: Allows tailoring of logging behavior to specific conditions.
Match allows provides the scope of the override.

customMetric.description: Allows free-form specification of a metric.

metric.description: One of the well-known Istio Standard Metrics.

operation.description: Operation controls whether or not to update/add a tag, or to remove it.

value.description: Value is only considered if the operation is `UPSERT`.

environment.description: Environment adds the value of an environment variable to each span.

name.description: Name of the environment variable from which to extract the tag value.
Name of the header from which to extract the tag value.

literal.description: Literal adds the same, hard-coded value to each span.

match.description: Allows tailoring of behavior to specific conditions.

status.description: Specifies the HTTP response status to be returned.

fault.description: Fault injection policy to apply on HTTP traffic at the client side.

grpcStatus.description: GRPC status code to use to abort the request.

httpStatus.description: HTTP status code to use to abort the Http request.

percentage.description: Percentage of requests to be aborted with the error code provided.

fixedDelay.description: Add a fixed delay before forwarding the request.

percent.description: Percentage of requests on which the delay will be injected (0-100).

percentage.description: Percentage of requests on which the delay will be injected.

gateways.description: Names of gateways where the rule should be applied.

ignoreUriCase.description: Flag to specify whether the URI matching should be case-insensitive.

name.description: The name assigned to a match.

port.description: Specifies the ports on the host that is being addressed.

sourceNamespace.description: Source namespace constraining the applicability of a rule to workloads in that namespace.

statPrefix.description: The human readable prefix to use when emitting statistics for this route.

withoutHeaders.description: withoutHeader has the same syntax with the header, but has opposite meaning.

host.description: The name of a service from the service registry.

port.description: Specifies the port on the host that is being addressed.

subset.description: The name of a subset within the service.

mirrorPercent.description: Percentage of the traffic to be mirrored by the `mirror` field.

mirrorPercentage.description: Percentage of the traffic to be mirrored by the `mirror` field.

mirror_percent.description: Percentage of the traffic to be mirrored by the `mirror` field.

name.description: The name assigned to the route for debugging purposes.

redirect.description: A HTTP rule can either return a direct_response, redirect or forward (default) traffic.

port.description: On a redirect, overwrite the port portion of the URL with this value.

scheme.description: On a redirect, overwrite the scheme portion of the URL with this value.

attempts.description: Number of retries to be allowed for a given request.

perTryTimeout.description: Timeout per attempt for a given request, including the initial call and any retries.

retryOn.description: Specifies the conditions under which retry takes place.

retryRemoteLocalities.description: Flag to specify whether the retries should retry to other localities.

rewrite.description: Rewrite HTTP URIs and Authority headers.

authority.description: rewrite the Authority/Host header with this value.

uriRegexRewrite.description: rewrite the path portion of the URI with the specified regex.

rewrite.description: The string that should replace into matching portions of original URI.

route.description: A HTTP rule can either return a direct_response, redirect or forward (default) traffic.

host.description: The name of a service from the service registry.

port.description: Specifies the port on the host that is being addressed.

subset.description: The name of a subset within the service.

weight.description: Weight specifies the relative proportion of traffic to be forwarded to the destination.

timeout.description: Timeout for HTTP requests, default is disabled.

tcp.description: An ordered list of route rules for opaque TCP traffic.

destinationSubnets.description: IPv4 or IPv6 ip addresses of destination with optional subnet.

gateways.description: Names of gateways where the rule should be applied.

port.description: Specifies the port on the host that is being addressed.

sourceNamespace.description: Source namespace constraining the applicability of a rule to workloads in that namespace.

sourceSubnet.description: IPv4 or IPv6 ip address of source with optional subnet.

route.description: The destination to which the connection should be forwarded to.

port.description: Specifies the port on the host that is being addressed.

sniHosts.description: SNI (server name indicator) to match on.

additionalPrinterColumns.description: CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC. Populated by the system. Read-only. Null for lists. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#metadata

spec.description: Configuration affecting label/content routing, sni routing, etc. See more details at: https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/networking/virtual-service.html

exportTo.description: A list of namespaces to which this virtual service is exported.

gateways.description: The names of gateways and sidecars that should apply these routes.

hosts.description: The destination hosts to which traffic is being sent.

http.description: An ordered list of route rules for HTTP traffic.

allowMethods.description: List of HTTP methods allowed to access the resource.

allowOrigin.description: The list of origins that are allowed to perform CORS requests.

allowOrigins.description: String patterns that match allowed origins.

name.description: Name specifies the name of the delegate VirtualService.

namespace.description: Namespace specifies the namespace where the delegate VirtualService resides.

directResponse.description: A HTTP rule can either return a direct_response, redirect or forward (default) traffic.

body.description: Specifies the content of the response body.

bytes.description: response body as base64 encoded bytes.

fault.description: Fault injection policy to apply on HTTP traffic at the client side.

additionalPrinterColumns.description: CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC. Populated by the system. Read-only. Null for lists. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#metadata
additionalPrinterColumns.name: Age

spec.description: Describes a collection of workload instances. See more details at: https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/networking/workload-group.html

metadata.description: Metadata that will be used for all corresponding `WorkloadEntries`.

probe.description: `ReadinessProbe` describes the configuration the user must provide for healthchecking on their workload.

exec.description: Health is determined by how the command that is executed exited.

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded.

host.description: Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP.

httpHeaders.description: Headers the proxy will pass on to make the request.

path.description: Path to access on the HTTP server.

port.description: Port on which the endpoint lives.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before readiness probes are initiated.

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe.

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed.

tcpSocket.description: Health is determined by if the proxy is able to connect.

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out.

template.description: Template to be used for the generation of `WorkloadEntry` resources that belong to this `WorkloadGroup`.

labels.description: One or more labels associated with the endpoint.

locality.description: The locality associated with the endpoint.

ports.description: Set of ports associated with the endpoint.

weight.description: The load balancing weight associated with the endpoint.

additionalPrinterColumns.description: CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC. Populated by the system. Read-only. Null for lists. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#metadata
additionalPrinterColumns.name: Age
